page.title: 03R.A.F. family, Houghton
page.content: In this area we have several large RAF stations. Because of this there are large numbers of servicemen and their families who only live in the area for a few years. This RAF family have had fifteen moves during dad's 22 years in the RAF. Their children had been to five different schools so they now go to boarding school. They find most of their friends within the RAF because, with moving, they find it difficult to make friends within the local population. The father is on long periods of stand-by and is often away from home on training. At these times his wife has complete responsibility for the family and home. He thinks he is doing a worthwhile task as he feels that he is helping to protect the kind of life we enjoy in this country.
